titleStmt.title: William A. M. Van Bokkelen, Oath
CWG7998

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

creation.placeName: Virginia City, Storey County, Nevada Territory

body.p: I William A. M. Van Bokkelen having been duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky a "Commissioner of Deeds" for said State to reside in the Territory of Nevada, do solemnly swear that I will perform the duties of such commissionoer well and truly as required by the laws of said state.
Subscribed & sworn to before me this 9th day of May A D 1863

Joseph F. Twill
Justice of the Peace for Virginia Precinct Storey County Nevada Territory

figure.ab:

VIRGINIA CITY STOREY COUNTY NEVADA TERRITORY

Nevada Ter

Oath
W. A. M. Van Bokklen
Filed June 4. 1863
